data.question: What is the molecular formula of the compound crystallized as a C2-symmetric species?
What are the kinetic reaction products of enPtII and bpz?
Which compound is obtained from 1 upon prolonged heating in water?
What is the thermodynamic product of enPtII and bpz?
How does the molecular triangle [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ differ in its all-cis and all-trans forms?
data.answer: They differ in their topologies, Pt−Pt distances, and anion binding properties.

data.question: What role do PF6- anions play in the supramolecular organization processes?
data.answer: PF6- anions are incorporated in the Pt3 triangles and play a structural role beyond charge neutralization.

data.question: Is the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ stable in solution?
Do the hexanuclear vases 3−6 display affinity for anions?
Can the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ incorporate two different anions simultaneously?
Is the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ a kinetic product?
Does the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ act as an anion receptor?
Is the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ converted into [{enPt(bpz-N1,N1')}2+] upon heating?
What is the empirical formula of the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3](NO3)2(ClO4)4·H2O?
What is the role of Ag+ ions in the formation of octanuclear and decanuclear compounds from the triangle 1?
data.answer: Ag+ ions link Pt3 triangles via N1,N1' positions to form higher-nuclearity compounds.

data.question: Does the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ incorporate NO3- and ClO4- anions in its all-cis form?
